Overcome Sensitiveness.--Many have a vivid, unsanctified sensitiveness which keeps them constantly on 


                                                 791 

the alert for some word, some look, or some action which they can construe as a lack of respect and appreciation. All this must be overcome. Everyone should go forward in the fear of God, doing his best without being troubled by praise or offended by censure, serving God fervently and learning to place the most favorable interpretation upon whatever in others may seem offensive.--MS 24, 1887. (HC 240.)
